thread.title: Watch NASA's Big Announcement About a "Discovery Beyond Our Solar System"
thread.title_full: Watch NASA's Big Announcement About a "Discovery Beyond Our Solar System"

title: Watch NASA's Big Announcement About a "Discovery Beyond Our Solar System"
text:
Watch NASA's Big Announcement About a "Discovery Beyond Our Solar System" 
Astronomers found something related to alien planets orbiting another star. Most Popular Feb 22, 2017   Update 1:00 p.m.: NASA has announced that the red dwarf star TRAPPIST-1 has seven orbiting planets, all about the size of Earth. Six are likely rocky, and all could possibly support liquid water. Read more about the discovery here . Related Story Seven Earth-Like Planets Orbit One Nearby Star Most Popular NASA is making a big announcement today about a discovery that has been made outside our solar system. The news conference begins at 1 p.m. EST, and you can watch a livestream above. Feel free to ask a question during the news conference on Twitter using #askNASA. The NASA announcement reads: 
NASA will hold a news conference at 1 p.m. EST Wednesday, Feb. 22, to present new findings on planets that orbit stars other than our sun, known as exoplanets. The event will air live on NASA Television and the agency's website. What could it be? We'll have to wait until 1 p.m. to find out! More from Popular Mechanics:
